course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Principles of Cell and Developmental Biology

notes.note: S/U or Letter grade. Biological science majors must take this course for a letter grade.

For enrollment contact Dr. Nero at DN13 to be waitlisted. PROBLEM SOLVING SESSIONS ARE STRONGLY RECOMMENDED: MONDAY OR WED. 8:30 - 10:00 AM. (3RD SESSION BY ARRANGEMENT WITH INSTRUCTOR). Not open to freshman fall semeser.

Prerequisite: BIOG 1500 recommended. Lab assignment made 1st day of classes. Labs are held Tues, Wed, Thurs, and F 2:30-4:30pm. Problem solving sessions are strongly recommended: Tues or Wed 8:30-10am. (3rd sesion by arrangement with instructor). Evening prelim April 14, 2011.
STUDY CENTER, SN219. CONCURRENT REGISTRATION IN BIOMG 3340 IS ENCOURAGED. ORGANIZATIONAL MEETING WEDNESDAY 8/25, 4:30 P.M. BAKER 200. ATTENDANCE REQUIRED.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Principles of Biochemistry: Proteins and Metabolism

notes.note: One majors level biology course and one year general chemistry and CHEM 1570 or 3570-3580(CHEM 1570 or 2570 should not be taken concurrently), or equivalent, or permission of instructor. Evening prelim Oct 21. An optional discussion section is held on most Friday's from 2:55-3:20pm focusing on issues such as application to medical school or graduate school, and undergraduate research.

CONCURRENT REGISTRATION IN BIOMG 3300 OR WRITTEN PERMISSION OF INSTRUCTOR REQUIRED. ORANIZATIONAL MEETING WEDNESDAY, 8/25 4:30PM IN BAKER 200. SECTIONS MEET IN G 04 STIMSON.
Limited to approx 100 students.

course.subject: BIOMG
course.course_title: Plant Molecular Biology I: Concepts and Techniques of Plant Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisites: BIOMG 2810 and 3300, 3330, 3350 or 3320, or equivalents. Recommended: BIOMG 3310.

2 or 3 credits. The optional 1 credit is for registered students with permission of instructor to review literature. Prerequisite: BIOMG 2810. Recommended: BIOMI 2900 and BIOMG 3300, 3330 or 3350, or 3310/3320.
Prereq: BIOMG 2810, 3300, 3320 or 3330 or NS 3200.

Prerequisites: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Note: Arts students may not count this course toward graduation but may, upon petition (one time only) to their class dean, carry fewer than 12 other credits and remain in good standing. This would affect Dean's List eligibility but not eligibility for graduating with distinction. S-U or letter grades by permission of the instructor.
Prerequisites: BIOMG 2810 and 3300, 3320 or 3330 or NS 3200.
Prerequisites: BIOMG 2810 or equivalent, BIOMG 3300 or 3330 or 3350 or 3310 or equivalent, and permission of instructor. S-U grades by permission of instructor.

Organizational meeting Tuesday August 31st 5:30-6:30, VRT T2-002D (final day and time to be decided) This course will explore the recent advances in our understanding of RNAi mechanisms through a series of student-run journal clubs coupled with introductory lectures. Class participation will be essential for improving student presentation skills and enhancing discussion.

This course will support the weekly seminar series in the department of Molecular Biology and Genetics (Fridays at 4:00, Biotechnology Building). At our initial meeting we will schedule one class participant for each MBG seminar (mbg.cornell.edu). This class participant will be responsible for contacting the seminar speaker a week or more in advance to inquire about a paper that will best capture the content of the MBG seminar.
LIMITED TO FIRST YR. GRAD. STUDENTS IN FIELD OF GENETICS & DEVELOPMENT.
